org.codehaus.preon.el
Interface Reference<E>

Type Parameters:
E - The type of environment on which this reference is based.
All Superinterfaces:
Descriptive, ReferenceContext<E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayElementReference, ArrayElementReference, BooleanLiteralReference, ClassReferenceContext, ContextReplacingReference, ConvertingReference, ImportSupportingObjectResolverContext.ClassReference, MultiReference, OuterReference, OuterResolvingReference, PropertyReference, PropertyReference
public interface Reference<E>
extends ReferenceContext<E>

A reference to an Object, based on an environment of type E.

Author:
Wilfred Springer

narrow

Reference<E> narrow(Class<?> type)
Narrow the reference to a reference of the given type. The resulting reference is expected to always evaluate to an instance of type.

In order to understand the effect of this operation, it is important to understand that there may sometimes be some ambiguity in a reference. Take for instance the MultiReference. Calling MultiReference.selectAttribute(String) will create another MultiReference, pointing to different properties of different types on different types of objects. Calling narrow(Class) will essentially drop all references not pointing to an instance of type.

Parameters:
type - Narrows the reference to a reference that is guaranteed to point to a subclass of type.
Returns:
A reference that is guaranteed to point to a subclass of type, or null if it cannot be narrowed.

isBasedOn

boolean isBasedOn(ReferenceContext<E> context)
Returns a boolean, indicating if the reference is based on the given context.

Parameters:
context -
Returns:
true if the outcome of the reference is based on the given context; false otherwise.
